summary: "I didn’t grow up in a man’s man world. I grew up with my mum and my sister. But I definitely think in the last two years, I’ve...
body:
“I didn’t grow up in a man’s man world. I grew up with my mum and my sister. But I definitely think in the last two years, I’ve become a lot more content with who I am. I think there’s so much masculinity in being vulnerable and allowing yourself to be feminine, and I’m very comfortable with that. Growing up you don’t even know what those things mean. You have this idea of what being masculine is and as you grow up and experience more of the world, you become more comfortable with who you are. Today it’s easier to embrace masculinity in so many different things. I definitely find – through music, writing, talking with friends and being open – that some of the times when I feel most confident is when I’m allowing myself to be vulnerable.”

Timothée Chalamet in conversation with Harry Styles

summary: You should write about the relation of YN with the fans! That would be really cool
question: You should write about the relation of YN with the fans! That would be really cool
answer:
I am so sorry that you had to wait so long for this but here you go, I am not in love with this and will probably re-write it a little bit.

But thank you for requesting! xx

___

i think there would be a mutual respect between both parties.

But, in the beginning the fans were a bit sceptical about you, like they were with all his ex-girlfriends. They didn’t know who you were and what your intentions were with Harry. But considering the fact that you were a ‘normal’ girl gave you some plus points from the beginning on.

You also aren’t a person to post much on social media, you weren’t before your relationship with Harry and that didn’t change when you started dating him. You liked your privacy and you respected Harry’s.You know he doesn’t like his personal life on display, so you made sure to not post about it, not even a post that may say you were with him. You only posted a picture when you were out with friends or just a beautiful landscape from a vacation.

These were the first signs to fans that you weren’t using him for his fame.

You knew how important the fans are to Harry and how much he loves them. You really admire the mutual love that there is between artist and fan. You also know how important it is to the fans to get an opportunity to ‘meet’ him even if it is just a simple picture and a hug from him.

So, when out on a date, you always give Harry the space to take pictures with the fans waiting outside. One time you even took the pictures for them. This was the moment even the biggest haters of your relationship calmed down a lot.

You knew from the beginning that dating Harry comes with more than just meeting and impressing his family. You also had to impress his fans. And yes, it wasn’t always easy. There were moments where you just wanted to go home immediately after going out and yes, it irritated you sometimes when fans judged you for something you said or something you posted.

But now that the relationship has been 2 years, you have accepted it and the fans have accepted you into their family. You weren’t as annoyed anymore when there was a fan who wanted a picture interrupting a date. It also didn’t happen as often anymore. Fans knew they could ask Harry for a picture anytime when he was out alone. But when he is out with you, he loved not being bothered. Also, the hate on your social media is almost non-existent. Of course there are still people who don’t like you but that’s okay.

You were also known with the fans for recognising them. Fans tweet a lot at you talking about their project they do for Harry like raising money for charity for his birthday and you made sure to support them and give them the promotion they need to achieve their goals.

Also at his concerts you were often standing in the crowd instead of backstage. You loved being around the fans and their energy and the fans loved it because it gave them a chance to chat with you.

At the end of the day you all love the same man and want to support him as much as possible and that’s why both you and the fans have a good relationship with each other.

reblog.comment:
I am so sorry that you had to wait so long for this but here you go, I am not in love with this and will probably re-write it a little bit.

But thank you for requesting! xx

title: story prompt ft. corpse bride
body:
“With this hand, I will lift your sorrows.

Your cup will never be empty for I will be your wine.

With this candle, I will light your way in darkness.

With this ring, I ask you to be mine”

Harry stopped reading and placed the old book on his stomach. It was almost unbelievable that he has read this passage in the book countless times yet now he still has to pause and take a deep breath, his vivid imagination of the scene gets him every time. Once again, he finds himself in deep thought. Does love always work that way? It is your strength and weakness at the same time, one moment you are in euphoria but then suddenly when it fails everything is demolished until all that remains is despair and emptiness. But the thing is, harry, a boy of fourteen, has read only one romance story among his novels about adventure and fiction, but in his young state he is highly unlikely planning on reading another one anytime soon. It is already queer that he is reading one at all, and he finds it even stranger sometimes that he is filled with the desire to read it again and again.

Precise knocks came from the other side of his bedroom door followed by the drone of old Alfred asking him to come down for dinner.

The boy sighed taking it upon himself to be ready for what’s to come. Tonight he will meet his future bride. His young mind, of course, was full of expectations but questions as well. Will she be Vicious? Pretentious? Ambitious? Or perhaps Intelligent? Interesting? He was young and too curious.

Very soon he was coming down for dinner and finds everyone else seated. As soon as he makes an appearance, the small talk slowly dies down and almost everyone stares at him expectantly. To say that he was a blushing mess is an understatement.

“Harry” his father nodded “our young man” he added proudly

Harry couldn’t help but be glad. His father’s praises always gave him courage, and of course, confidence. He strode over to the empty seat at the end of the table right beside Gemma.

They made a toast to the future and good health for both families. And so it began.

Harry

I couldn’t keep my eyes to myself. The people occupying the seats were making my mind burst with questions

The dinner was supposed to be in honor of my future marriage with Victoria, a young lady of the same age as I am. I couldn’t deny that she was beautiful, she had soft brown eyes and dark caramel hair, her sharp cheekbones and defined features gave her an aura of profound sophistication, she had a fine figure for her age, she was prim and pristine just like every lad would have dreamed for a bride. I was very delighted at this fact, and couldn’t wait to be able to talk to her in private and I hope that she would share with me the same interest in books. Although, right beside her is a very similar person, that peculiarly triggers most of my interest. They had the same air of confidence and sophistication, sharp defined features and dark caramel hair. The only significant difference between them were their eyes, the boy’s sockets -instead of soft brown orbs- contained piercing cerulean eyes. They were the most electrifying blue and I was mildly afraid that making eye contact with the said person would give me a minor electric shock.

Their father, Mr. Tomlinson was a thin, sharp and brisk man and I found him as mundane as any. But Mrs. Tomlinson was another story, in my opinion, her children were lucky to inherit her very pleasant features.  Only she and the boy had the very same enticing blue eyes.

reblog.comment:

It was almost unbelievable that he has read this passage in the book countless times yet now he still has to pause and take a deep breath, his vivid imagination of the scene gets him every time. Once again, he finds himself in deep thought. Does love always work that way? It is your strength and weakness at the same time, one moment you are in euphoria but then suddenly when it fails everything is demolished until all that remains is despair and emptiness. But the thing is, harry, a boy of fourteen, has read only one romance story among his novels about adventure and fiction, but in his young state he is highly unlikely planning on reading another one anytime soon. It is already queer that he is reading one at all, and he finds it even stranger sometimes that he is filled with the desire to read it again and again.

Precise knocks came from the other side of his bedroom door followed by the drone of old Alfred asking him to come down for dinner.

The boy sighed taking it upon himself to be ready for what’s to come. Tonight he will meet his future bride. His young mind, of course, was full of expectations but questions as well. Will she be Vicious? Pretentious? Ambitious? Or perhaps Intelligent? Interesting? He was young and too curious.

Very soon he was coming down for dinner and finds everyone else seated. As soon as he makes an appearance, the small talk slowly dies down and almost everyone stares at him expectantly. To say that he was a blushing mess is an understatement.

“Harry” his father nodded “our young man” he added proudly

Harry couldn’t help but be glad. His father’s praises always gave him courage, and of course, confidence. He strode over to the empty seat at the end of the table right beside Gemma.

They made a toast to the future and good health for both families. And so it began.

Harry

I couldn’t keep my eyes to myself. The people occupying the seats were making my mind burst with questions

The dinner was supposed to be in honor of my future marriage with Victoria, a young lady of the same age as I am. I couldn’t deny that she was beautiful, she had soft brown eyes and dark caramel hair, her sharp cheekbones and defined features gave her an aura of profound sophistication, she had a fine figure for her age, she was prim and pristine just like every lad would have dreamed for a bride. I was very delighted at this fact, and couldn’t wait to be able to talk to her in private and I hope that she would share with me the same interest in books. Although, right beside her is a very similar person, that peculiarly triggers most of my interest. They had the same air of confidence and sophistication, sharp defined features and dark caramel hair. The only significant difference between them were their eyes, the boy’s sockets -instead of soft brown orbs- contained piercing cerulean eyes. They were the most electrifying blue and I was mildly afraid that making eye contact with the said person would give me a minor electric shock.

Their father, Mr. Tomlinson was a thin, sharp and brisk man and I found him as mundane as any. But Mrs. Tomlinson was another story, in my opinion, her children were lucky to inherit her very pleasant features.  Only she and the boy had the very same enticing blue eyes.

trail.content_raw:
“With this hand, I will lift your sorrows.

Your cup will never be empty for I will be your wine.

With this candle, I will light your way in darkness.

With this ring, I ask you to be mine”
